intro: Petalostemon flavescens, commonly known as the yellow petalostemon, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its floral structure includes two lips, with the upper lip being shorter than the lower lip, which is a common feature in the Scrophulariaceae family. Petalostemon flavescens is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in the humid, shaded environment.
